node.title: More Black Summers ahead as climate change increases risk of megafires: CSIRO
node.alt: A firefighter pulls a hose in a blaze
node.description: Research shows climate change has increased the frequency and extent of megafires in Australia, with scientists warning the year following a La Niña is the most treacherous.
node.content:
["Climate change is increasing the frequency of megafires in Australia and\u00a0putting entire ecosystems at risk, new research by the CSIRO has found.", "Over the past three decades, Australian forests have undergone an 800 per cent increase in the extent of the area\u00a0burnt bushfires, with researchers warning ecosystems are\u00a0at risk because they are not able to recover between devastating infernos.", "The research, published in the journal Nature Communications, is based on a first-of-its-kind study that\u00a0used 32 years of satellite data and 90 years of ground-based datasets from\u00a0climate and weather observations.", "The increase in burnt areas has not been limited to the summer months. Since 1988,\u00a0the fire season has extended into the cooler\u00a0months, with a more than\u00a0fivefold increase in the annual mean burnt\u00a0area in winter and a threefold increase in autumn.", "\"All these things have\u00a0completely changed over the last 15 years, where fundamentally fire has spread throughout\u00a0the entire 12 months,\" CSIRO chief research scientist Dr Pep Canadell said.", "", "
The health impacts of megafires, including from\u00a0bushfire smoke,\u00a0can be significant.(ABC News: Jonathan Hair)
", "Dr Canadell said the study combined\u00a0analysis of\u00a0previous\u00a0forest fire sites with\u00a0eight\u00a0drivers of fire activity, including\u00a0climate, fuel accumulation,\u00a0ignition\u00a0and prescribed burning.\u00a0\u00a0", "\"While all eight drivers of fire activity played varying roles\u00a0in influencing forest fires,\u00a0climate was\u00a0the\u00a0overwhelming\u00a0factor\u00a0driving fire activity,\" he said.", "
Hazard reduction not a factor
", "Since\u00a0the Black Summer bushfires,\u00a0there has been fierce debate over the role\u00a0hazard reduction burns played in the severity of the fires, but Dr Canadell says\u00a0prescribed burning has not actually changed.", "\"Overall, prescribed burning really hasn't changed at all and, perhaps most importantly, just to realise that we are burning one\u00a0per cent\u00a0per year of the forests, which is a really a small amount,\" he said.", "", "
Over the past 30 years,\u00a0Australian forests have seen an 800 per cent increase in burnt areas.(ABC News: Mridula Amin )
", "CSIRO scientist Mick Meyer agreed and said prescribed burning was mostly done to protect assets.", "\"If you tried to burn the whole of the country, you'd be changing the ecosystems in effect,\"\u00a0he said.", "
Don't be fooled by La Ni\u00f1a
", "Dr Canadell also warns\u00a0that despite a reprieve with wet conditions this year due to a La Ni\u00f1a, the year following such a weather phenomenon\u00a0typically brings a bad fire season.", "\"The highest area of burn actually comes\u00a0right after a La Ni\u00f1a year, because the wetness across the continent really brings up the fuel loads,\" he said.", "", "
The Black Summer bushfires left widespread carnage across the east coast of Australia.(ABC News: Mridula Amin )
"]
